definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: In some places swimmers may encounter strong undertows or ocean currents.
sentences.chinese: 在一些地方游泳者可能遇到強勢的暗流或者洋流。

sentences.english: The undercurrents are always there in his mind and in his gut.
sentences.chinese: 這股暗流一直都在他的思想和他的內心裏存在着。

sentences.english: There was something even richer than that, running as a hidden strain, in her mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的心裏還有一股比喜歡更深厚的感情暗流。

sentences.english: On the streets of Seoul, there was no sense of panic, but rather an undercurrent of anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 在漢城的街道，沒有恐慌感，而是一種焦慮的暗流。

sentences.english: Anyone who has been caught in a nasty undercurrent knows the power of the tides.
sentences.chinese: 遭遇過險惡暗流的人都知道潮汐的力量。

sentences.english: There was an undercurrent of antipathy between them.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩人之間潛伏着一股反感的暗流。

sentences.english: There is a violent undercurrent that sometimes leads to street demonstrations or parliamentary brawls, and the Japanese struggle to contain it.
sentences.chinese: 一種暴力的暗流時常會導致街頭示威或議會爭吵。

sentences.english: However, they remain worried about political undercurrents among their people.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他們仍然擔心政治暗流之間的本國人民。

sentences.english: Underneath it can be seen an curious underground stream or duct.
sentences.chinese: 在它下面可以看見一奇怪的暗流或輸送管。

sentences.english: Riptide is a strong underwater current.
sentences.chinese: 激潮是海面下一種強大的暗流。

sentences.english: The invader sensed an undercurrent of resentment among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 不速之客在人羣中察覺到一絲仇恨的暗流。

sentences.english: There is a sense of danger lurking and the film is all the better for the darker, more grown-up undercurrents .
sentences.chinese: 這部電影勾勒出了潛伏的危機和更加洶湧的暗流。

sentences.english: The article was full of racist undertones.
sentences.chinese: 這篇文章充滿了種族主義的暗流。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
against the stream/adverse current/a countercurrent/fig. reactionary tendency/to go against the trend
